title: 13 Eco-Friendly Swaps for Dorm Life: A Freshman Guide - Her Campus
body: Ditch plastic utensils for reusable sets. Takeout food is, unfortunately, going to be the routine for this year and you will be offered plenty of plastic containers, utensils and cups. If possible, bring along a bamboo utensil set to avoid waste. Reusable straws are also a great way to avoid plastic and live a more sustainable lifestyle.
readable_content:
- **Anna Thetard** (2022-04-18): The Her Campus National Editors write about products we love and think you’ll love too. Her Campus has affiliate partnerships, so we get a share of the revenue from your purchase. All products are in stock and all prices are accurate as of publication.

This article is written by a student writer from the Her Campus at VCU chapter.

It’s the summer before your freshman year of college and you’re splurging on dorm essentials. Totally overwhelming, I know. I remember taking the entire summer months to research the most eco-friendly products I could find to make dorm life easy and nonexpensive. Here are some of my favorite tips and brands to help live the best eco-conscious lifestyle in the dorms in your first year at college.

**13 ECO-FRIENDLY SWAPS FOR DORM LIFE: A FRESHMAN GUIDE**

SWITCH YOUR PLASTIC TOOTHBRUSH FOR A BAMBOO ONE

Shampoo and conditioner bars

Brita filter instead of water bottles

Ditch plastic utensils for reusable sets

- ...
